column4: I just read the Ars Technica story about Feisty being released, and Compbiz being in there by default.  I thought they left Compbiz outta Feisty because of stability issues?

Ubuntu 7.04 also includes built-in support for compositing and 3D desktop effects via Compiz in the default installation. from http://arstechnica.com/news.ars/post/20070420-ubuntu-7-04-feisty-officially-released.html
Yes, "built in support" != turned on by default
Look at any tutorial for compiz, you might also want to download the compiz settings manager, it will also tell you all of the key bindings
You can also just go to a page with flash content and have Firefox install it
have you got a site that will let me click and auto-install Flash 9?  The site I just went to doesn't do that.
packages don't get updated after release except for bug fixes, and Gutsy is not fully merged with all upstream packages
That's what I'm saying though.  svk 2.0 came out four months before Feisty was released.
svk 2.0 came out in December.  Fesity came out in April.  Unless they froze Feisty five months before it was released... yes, before the freeze.
svk is community maintained so you should ask the maintainer
Look at the werid char in ubotu's output just before "sudo mount".
what they don't know won't hurt them
It would be different if he weren't asking the type of questions they talk about all the time.
But if they ask for output...
If they find out, they find out, it's not a big deal getting caught.  They may bitch, they may not.
